text: Cross Ludlow, past the mailbox on the corner,
speaker: Subject

text: Risque Video, Dino's Pizza and the Emerald Laundromat+.

text: The fruit trucks tucked into Forty Fourth street on the left,
speaker: Subject

text: house eyes shut with boards fringes of children.
speaker: Subject

text: Once we went into a store sunk into the street,
speaker: Subject

text: owned by a Cambodian woman.
speaker: Subject

text: She sold everything, from evening gowns to soup.
speaker: Subject

text: Over to Walnut and Forty Fifth, where the Muslim cat sells this chicken wrapped in pita, draped in cucumber sauce.
speaker: Subject

text: The pregnant woman behind the counter writes our order out in Arabic.
speaker: Subject

text: We grab a juice from the freezer, some chips, eye the bean and sweet potato pies
speaker: Subject

text: Back into the hot breath of West Philly, sun is setting.
speaker: Subject

text: The sky is smeared squash, tangerines in a glaze.
speaker: Subject

text: Three girls and one boy jump double dutch.
speaker: Subject

text: A white man hustles from the video store with a black plastic bag.
speaker: Subject

text: We look for money in the street, steal flowers from the church lawn.
speaker: Subject

text: The shit stain from the wino is still on our step.
speaker: Subject

text: Mister Jim is washing a car for cash.
speaker: Subject

text: John is cleaning his rims to Buju Banton.
speaker: Subject

text: Noel is talking sweetly to the big blue eyed woman.
speaker: Subject

text: Linda, on her way to the restaurant.
speaker: Subject

speaker: Subject

text: buzzes by with her headphones on.
speaker: Subject

text: One night,
speaker: Subject

text: a man was shot and killed on this block,
speaker: Subject

text: right outside our thick wood door.
speaker: Subject

text: But not today.
speaker: Subject

text: Today is one of those days to come home from walking in the world,
speaker: Subject

speaker: Subject

text: toenails.

text: Lullaby at Seven Months
speaker: Subject

text: I have this feeling
speaker: Subject

text: that my heart will break from the knowing of you
speaker: Subject

text: so every day I will hold myself to the fire of love
speaker: Subject

text: and sing you the lullabies of my dreams
speaker: Subject

text: and even as I hold you
speaker: Subject

text: I will divine and fashion my heart for the letting go
speaker: Subject

text: imagining space without your scent
speaker: Subject

text: your newness
speaker: Subject

text: I will send the ashes of all the ghosts who threatened our feast to the winds that run counter
speaker: Subject

text: and I have this feeling
speaker: Subject

text: that the deepest cracks in my heart
speaker: Subject

text: will be cemented with joy
speaker: Subject

text: First Poem at Forty
speaker: Subject

text: Today, I'm forty
speaker: Subject

text: The years have added up
speaker: Subject

text: Virginia Slims sayings pepper the air
speaker: Subject

text: I wear my womanhood like a ((shearling)) on the subway
speaker: Subject

text: royal minks in the bathroom of Suburban Station
speaker: Subject

text: I am here
speaker: Subject

text: I am still here
speaker: Subject

text: I have not been broken beyond repair
speaker: Subject

text: I am purple onion, red lemon, lead paint on the windowsill
speaker: Subject

text: The web between toes
speaker: Subject

text: I want to write ((bishop)) poems about fish for the next forty years, and who will stop me?
speaker: Subject

text: Who will stand in my way?
speaker: Subject

text: Certainly not the ghost who visit in my sleep. Certainly not some half formed girl of my nightmares.
speaker: Subject

text: Only me
speaker: Subject

text: I am the grind ((in)) the force. I am the turning wheel, the luminous walk of water along the river of a curb
speaker: Subject

text: I'm ((Yvonda's)) daughter, and better and cold for it
speaker: Subject

text: The grandfather clocks are chanting songs about my second handedness,
speaker: Subject

text: my two headedness,
speaker: Subject

text: my third womb
speaker: Subject

text: No gurus to pull out my teeth
speaker: Subject

text: No kites to hang my woes upon
speaker: Subject

text: I am the fray in the string before it splits
speaker: Subject

text: I am the break in my own heart
speaker: Subject

text: This is forty
speaker: Subject

text: This is forty, my love

speaker: Subject

speaker: Subject

text: You want to write something full of alchemy
speaker: Subject

text: that'll make people sit up in their chakras and go, mm
speaker: Subject

text: Make somebody remember you for ages when you leave the room
speaker: Subject

text: Not fight your way through the crowd but mingle and descend like tar residue from the ceiling
speaker: Subject

text: You want to leave a trace of yourself on the cotton of people
speaker: Subject

text: You want the band to know your name, the mic to know your mist, the poem to pull your strings and make you dance
speaker: Subject

speaker: Subject

text: bring the ailing from their beds

text: Mandingo
speaker: Subject

text: Grew up in the bay of Montigo
speaker: Subject

text: Child of martyr said he'd rather be my hero, reinvent me in the coves of Montenegro
speaker: Subject

text: Bilingual, he altered the way of my lingo. His tongue had a style so instinctual, untied my vines and bewitched my mango
